tit.e: Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)
tit.cmt: (government post) government postには違いないと思いますが、これだと中央官僚のようにも聞こえるので、regional governor in ancient Japan（古代日本の地域の統括者）としました。
tit.e: Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko (regional governor in ancient Japan)

sen.j: 无邪志国造（むさしのくにのみやつこ・むさしこくぞう）は武蔵国東部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Musashinokuninomiyatsuko 无邪志国造 (also known as Musashikokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the east part of Musashi Province.
Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko (无邪志国造), also known as Musashi kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the east part of Musashi Province.
Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko (无邪志国造), also known as Musashi kokuzo, was a kuni no miyatsuko that ruled the east part of Musashi Province.

sen.j: 無邪志国造・武蔵国造とも。
sen.e: It was also written as 無邪志国造 and 武蔵国造.
It was also written as 無邪志国造 or 武蔵国造.
It was also written as 無邪志国造 or 武蔵国造.

sen.j: 武夷鳥命。
sen.e: Takehinadorinomikoto.
Takehinadori no mikoto.
Takehinadori no mikoto.

sen.j: 出雲国造・遠淡国造・上菟上国造・下菟上国造・伊自牟国造などと同系。
sen.e: The clan was descended from the same line as Izumonokuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuominokuninomiyatsuko, Kamituunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Shimotsuunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko, and the like.

The clan was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuni no miyatsuko, Tootsuomi no kuni no miyatsuko, Kamituunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko, and the like.

The clan was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuni no miyatsuko, Tootsuomi no kuni no miyatsuko, Kamituunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Shimotsuunakami kuni no miyatsuko, Ijimu no kuni no miyatsuko, and the like.

sen.j: 成務天皇朝に二井之宇迦諸忍之神狭命の10世孫の兄多毛比命が无邪志国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: It is said that Etamohinomikoto, the 10th descendants from Futainoukamoroonokamusanomikoto was appointed Musashinokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
It is said that Etamohi no mikoto, the 10th descendant from Futaino ukamoroo no kamusa no mikoto was appointed as Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.
It is said that Etamohi no mikoto, the 10th descendant from Futaino ukamoroo no kamusa no mikoto was appointed as Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: 丈部氏、のち武蔵氏。
sen.e: The Hasetsukabe clan, later, the Musashi clan.
The Hasetsukabe clan, later, the Musashi clan.
The Hasetsukabe clan, later, the Musashi clan.

sen.j: 姓は直だが、のち宿禰。
sen.e: Kabane was Atai, but later, Sukune.
Kabane was Atai, but later, Sukune.
Kabane was Atai, but later, Sukune.

sen.j: 一族として笠原氏・物部氏・大伴氏・檜隈舎人氏などがある。
sen.e: The clan includes the Kasahara clan, the Mononobe clan, the Otomo clan, and the Hinokumatoneri clan.
The clan includes the Kasahara clan, the Mononobe clan, the Otomo clan, and the Hinokumatoneri clan.
The clan includes the Kasahara clan, the Mononobe clan, the Otomo clan, and the Hinokumatoneri clan.

sen.j: 武蔵氏・大伴氏は武蔵国足立郡（東京都足立区と埼玉県東南部）。
sen.e: The bases of the Musashi clan and the Otomo clan were in Adachi Gun, Musashi Province (Adachi Ward, Tokyo and the Southeast part of Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Musashi clan and the Otomo clan were in Adachi Gun, Musashi Province (Adachi Ward, Tokyo and the Southeast part of Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Musashi clan and the Otomo clan were in Adachi Gun, Musashi Province (Adachi Ward, Tokyo and the Southeast part of Saitama Prefecture.)

sen.j: 笠原氏は武蔵国埼玉郡笠原郷（埼玉県鴻巣市）。
sen.e: The bases of the Kasahara clan was in Kasahara Go, Saitama Gun, Musashi Province (Konosu City, Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Kasahara clan was in Kasahara Go, Saitama Gun, Musashi Province (Konosu City, Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Kasahara clan was in Kasahara Go, Saitama Gun, Musashi Province (Konosu City, Saitama Prefecture.)

sen.j: 物部氏は武蔵国入間郡（埼玉県入間市・川越市・狭山市・所沢市・富士見市・ふじみ野市など）。
sen.e: The bases of the Mononobe clan was Iruma Gun, Musashi Province (Iruma City, Kawagoe City, Sayama City, Tokorozawa City, Fujimi City, Fujimino City, Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Mononobe clan was Iruma Gun, Musashi Province (Iruma City, Kawagoe City, Sayama City, Tokorozawa City, Fujimi City, Fujimino City, Saitama Prefecture.)
The bases of the Mononobe clan was Iruma Gun, Musashi Province (Iruma City, Kawagoe City, Sayama City, Tokorozawa City, Fujimi City, Fujimino City, Saitama Prefecture.)

sen.j: 大國魂神社 (府中市) ...... 東京都府中市 (東京都)。
sen.e: The Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Fuchu City): Fuchu City, Tokyo
The Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Fuchu City): Fuchu City, Tokyo
The Okunitama-jinja Shrine (Fuchu City): Fuchu City, Tokyo

sen.j: 祭神は大国主命と同一神とされる大国魂神。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is Okunitamanokami, which is identified with Okuninushinomikoto.
The enshrined deity is Okunitamanokami, which is identified with Okuninushinomikoto.
The enshrined deity is Okunitamanokami, which is identified with Okuninushinomikoto.

sen.j: 氷川神社 ...... 埼玉県さいたま市大宮区。
sen.e: The Hikawa-jinja Shrine: Omiya Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.
The Hikawa-jinja Shrine: Omiya Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.
The Hikawa-jinja Shrine: Omiya Ward, Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture.

sen.j: 祭神は大己貴命・奇稲田姫命。
sen.e: The enshrined deity was Ohoanamuchinokami and Kushiinadamine.
The enshrined deity was Ohoanamuchinokami and Kushiinadamine.
The enshrined deity was Ohoanamuchinokami and Kushiinadamine.

sen.j: 物部天神社 ...... 埼玉県所沢市。
sen.e: The Mononobeten-jinja Shrine: Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture
The Mononobeten-jinja Shrine: Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture
The Mononobeten-jinja Shrine: Tokorozawa City, Saitama Prefecture

sen.j: 祭神は饒速日命。
sen.e: The enshrined deity is Nigihayanomikoto.
The enshrined deity is Nigihayanomikoto.
The enshrined deity is Nigihayanomikoto.

sen.j: 物部国造家の祖神。
sen.e: That is Oyagami of the Mononobekuninomiyatsuko family.
That is Oyagami, an ancestry god of the family of Mononobe kuni no miyatsuko.
That is Oyagami, an ancestry god of the family of Mononobe kuni no miyatsuko.

sen.j: 笠原使主 ...... 安閑天皇朝の武蔵国造。
sen.e: Kasahara no omi: Musashinokuninomiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.
KASAHARA no Omi: Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.
KASAHARA no Omi: Musashi no kuni no miyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Ankan.

sen.j: 笠原小杵と相続争いを起こした。
sen.e: Kasahara no omi had a dispute about an inheritance with Kasahara no oki.
Had a dispute about an inheritance with KASAHARA no OKI.
Had a dispute about an inheritance with KASAHARA no OKI.

sen.j: 物部兄麻呂 ...... 推古天皇朝の舎人。
sen.e: Mononobenoemaro: Toneri in the reign of Emperor Suiko.
MONONOBE no Emaro: a Toneri, active during the reign of Emperor Suiko.
MONONOBE no Emaro: a Toneri, active during the reign of Emperor Suiko.

sen.j: 武蔵国造。
sen.e: Musashinokuninomiyatsuko
Musashino kuni no miyatsuko
Musashino kuni no miyatsuko

sen.j: 丈部不破麻呂 ...... 奈良時代の官人。
sen.e: Hasetsukabenofuwamaro: A government official during the Nara period.
HASETSUKABE no Fuwamaro: A government official during the Nara period.
HASETSUKABE no Fuwamaro: A government official during the Nara period.

sen.j: 藤原仲麻呂の乱の功績で武蔵宿禰を賜り、武蔵国造に任じられた。
sen.e: He was conferred on Musashinosukune and appointed Musashinokuninomiyatsuko in recognition of his services in the Rebellion by Fujiwara no Nakamaro.
He was given a title of Sukune by the Yamato Court for his services in the Rebellion by Fujiwara no Nakamaro, thus became Musashi no sukune, and was appointed as Musashi no kun in omiyatsuko.
He was given a title of Sukune by the Yamato Court for his services in the Rebellion by Fujiwara no Nakamaro, thus became Musashi no sukune, and was appointed as Musashi no kun in omiyatsuko.
